messages: 4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:07): Could I get some help with a game controller I just bought?
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:11): But when I try to test it, it just won't work I know it's sending the signal because the light goes on when I press a button.
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:12): possible interference from other wireless devices?
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:12): Naw. I have no other wireless devices.
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:13): I think that it may be that I need to emulate a windows 2000 PC, how would I go about doing that?
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:13): oooh you got me there, dunno how to emulate a win2000 pc.
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:13): hey Stonenewt, Alcohol 120% is a CD burning program?
9d34e8d80cc917979ce7a15be472196d (16:14): CD image creation, emulation & burnig tool
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:14): i thought you were just messing with me yesterday when i said i couldn't burn an ISO
ad4599b85caeb58a9c0d611527c4a1d2 (16:14): alcohol 120% allows you to mount iso's and fool windows into thinking it's a cd
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:14): Stonenewt: The light is the one that goes on when I press a button or move the anolouge stick.
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:14): I used a simalar program to allow me to run a game without the disk ;)
9d34e8d80cc917979ce7a15be472196d (16:15): 120% does that and creates CD images as well as burning them
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:15): i thought you were telling me to go get actual alcohol and light the cd on fire
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:15): hence the, "we only have rubbing alcohol" statement
4e3547fdea219aa0ae5f7df51a9ad7c6 (16:18): Meh. I give up, it was only ¬£1 from the market :D
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:24): i found a microsoft KB article on the "cd recording software disabled" message i was getting and was able to get rid of it
9d34e8d80cc917979ce7a15be472196d (16:27): what I use it for is that I can use it to make CD/DVD images of games the use them instead of the original discs
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:29): i tried that once, didn't go over so well
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:31): and i know an internet cafe that uses a system like that
94d5ada1e18eae1814956d2be5ddded9 (16:32): they've got images of the CDs on the PCs and you have to "eject" the image and replace it with another one when you wanna play games
9d34e8d80cc917979ce7a15be472196d (16:35): some games hate it others don't mind... there's a tool somewhere that returns hardware ID of every optical drive of a random drive DVD-ROM drive
